# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/msgpack/exceptions.py
@source-hash: 7424d67a2f1da64a
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:58:45Z

## Primary Purpose
Exception hierarchy for the msgpack serialization library, providing specific error types for unpacking and packing operations with msgpack format data.

## Key Classes and Functions

**UnpackException (L1-7)** - Base exception class for msgpack unpacking errors. Contains important note that not all unpacking errors inherit from this class, recommending catching `Exception` for comprehensive error handling.

**BufferFull (L10-11)** - Signals buffer capacity exceeded during unpacking operations.

**OutOfData (L14-15)** - Indicates insufficient data available to complete unpacking operation.

**FormatError (L18-19)** - Multiple inheritance from `ValueError` and `UnpackException`. Raised when msgpack format is invalid or corrupted.

**StackError (L22-23)** - Multiple inheritance from `ValueError` and `UnpackException`. Indicates excessive nesting depth in msgpack data structure.

**ExtraData (L30-43)** - Inherits from `UnpackValueError` (which aliases `ValueError`). Raised during one-shot unpacking when trailing data remains after successful unpacking. Stores both the unpacked data (`unpacked` attribute) and remaining bytes (`extra` attribute).

## Type Aliases and Deprecations

**UnpackValueError (L27)** - Deprecated alias for `ValueError`
**PackException (L46)** - Deprecated alias for `Exception` 
**PackValueError (L47)** - Deprecated alias for `ValueError`
**PackOverflowError (L48)** - Deprecated alias for `OverflowError`

## Architecture Notes
- Dual inheritance pattern used for `FormatError` and `StackError` to maintain compatibility with standard Python exception types
- Clear separation between unpacking-specific exceptions and general error types
- Legacy aliases maintained for backward compatibility while guiding users toward standard exceptions
